questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

How would an administrator accomplish the given configuration leveraging the firewall capabilities within VMware Cloud on AWS?
A.
✑ Create a gateway firewall rule permitting bi-directional traffic to Subnet A from the Internet.
✑ Create a gateway firewall rule denying bi-directional traffic to Subnet B and Suubnet C from the Internet.
✑ Create a distributed firewall rule under the Application category to permit bi-directional traffic from Subnet A to Subnet B and from Subnet B to Subnet C.
B.
✑ Create a gateway firewall rule permitting bi-directional traffic to Subnet A from the Internet.
✑ Create a distributed firewall rule denying bi-directional traffic to Subnet B and Subnet C from the Internet.
✑ Create a distributed firewall rule under the Ethernet category to permit bi-directional traffic from Subnet A to Subnet B and from Subnet B to Subnet C.
C.
✑ Create a gateway firewall rule permitting bi-directional traffic to Subnet A from the Internet.
✑ Create a gateway firewall rule denying bi-directional traffic from the Internet to all subnets.
✑ Create a distributed firewall rule under the Infrastructure category to permit bi-directional traffic from Subnet A to Subnet B and from Subnet B to Subnet C.
D.
✑ Create a gateway firewall rule permitting bi-directional traffic to Subnet A from the Internet.
✑ Create a gateway firewall rule denying bi-directional traffic to Subnet B and Subnet C from the Internet.
Create a gateway firewall rule to permit bi-directional traffic from Subnet A to Subnet B and from Subnet B to Subnet C.
//IMG//

discussion.content: I think the correct answer is A. Use the GW firewall to protect N-S traffic and the Distributed Firewall to protect E-W traffic.
I agree with A
the correct answer is D, distributed firewall does not perform L3 routing which is needed to route between subnets

comments.content:
I correct my answer, routing is done by distributed routing hence the application category.
Answer is A

discussion.content: I agree with A
The correct is B, https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.2/administration/GUID-6AB240DB-949C-4E95-A9A7-4AC6EF5E3036.html

comments.content: Its true, correct answer is A
According to the Picture it shows N-S traffic. Then How it can Fall under Distributed Firewall???

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
Only valid choice
B C E are correct

The following Vmware cloud on aws service roles can be assigned:

>> Administrator : has full cloud admin rights to all services features in VMC on aws
>> Adminstrator (delete Restricted ) : Has full cloud admin rights to all services features in the VMC on aws console. However this role cannot delete SDDC or Clusters. 
>> NSX Cloud Auditor : Views NSX Services settings and events but cannot change the services.
>> NSX Cloud Admin : Can do all the tasks related to the NSX Service.

Selected Answer: BCE
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vmc-aws.getting-started/GUID-83DC5E26-B1C5-47C2-B14C-940D01B2A44C.html

questions.question_text: Which three of the listed VMware Cloud on AWS service roles can be assigned from the VMware Cloud console? (Choose three.)

An administrator has deployed VMware Cloud on AWS and requires a single broadcast domain for a set of virtual machines that reside both in the data center and in the software-defined data center (SDDC) over a DirectConnect connection. How can the administrator accomplish this without adding additional components in the cloud?

choices.C: Use a third-party networking tool to extend the broadcast domain.
choices.A: Duplicate the IP space in both locations and manually move the virtual machines.
choices.D: Deploy VMware HCX and a Service Mesh with a Network Extension appliance.
choices.B: Deploy a Layer 2 Virtual Private Network (L2VPN).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vmc-aws.networking-security/GUID-8BBB5707-8FB3-4F05-AEC3-668FD8EA6B8E.html

Selected Answer: B
B is the right choice

B - You can use a VMware Cloud on AWS layer 2 Virtual Private Network (L2VPN) to extend your on-premises network to one or more VLAN-based networks in your SDDC. This extended network is a single subnet with a single broadcast domain. You can use it to migrate VMs to and from your cloud SDDC without having to change their IP addresses
B is correct.

Selected Answer: AB
C & D are Hybrid, not full datacentre evacuation. VMC is multi-AZ, not multi-region and it (stretched cluster) isn’t automatic.

I think A and B. A. When moving to VMC on AWS ther is no need to refactor the apps.
B. The skills required for managing on-prem SDDC are the same as thse for VMC on AWS.

Selected Answer: AB
removing need for application transformation is key along with not learning new skills.

Provide a hybrid cloud management solution. This will allow the administrator to manage both the on-premises software-defined data center (SDDC) and the VMware Cloud on AWS environment using the same tools and processes. The letter for this option is A.

Maintain existing investment in skills and toolsets. By completing a full data center evacuation, the administrator can continue to use their existing skills and toolsets, such as vSphere and vCenter, to manage the workloads in the VMware Cloud on AWS environment. The letter for this option is B.

Therefore, the correct answer is A and B.

Option A is incorrect because completing a full data center evacuation does not remove the need for application transformation. Depending on the workloads being migrated, the administrator may still need to make changes to the applications to ensure that they can run effectively in the cloud.

Option C is incorrect because providing a hybrid cloud management solution is one of the benefits of completing a full data center evacuation.

comments.content: A is correct. As lift and shift migration, you don´t need to transform the application.

discussion.content: I agree with A & B

choices.C: Provide a hybrid cloud management solution.
choices.B: Maintain existing investment in skills and toolsets.
choices.D: Provide a seamless way to expand the on-premises software-defined data center (SDDC) into the cloud.
choices.A: Reduce the risk of migrating applications to the cloud by removing the need for application transformation.
choices.E: Diversify the risk associated with migrating applications to the cloud by automatically deploying workloads to multiple regions.

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of completing a full data center evacuation to VMware Cloud on AWS? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Configure network connectivity and firewall rules to allow communications between the two on-premises connection servers.
choices.F: Connect the two VMware Horizon pods together using a Horizon Cloud Pod Architecture (CPA).
choices.E: Connect the two VMware Horizon pods together using the security servers.
choices.D: Configure network connectivity and firewall rules to allow communications between on-premises and VMware Cloud on AWS connection servers.
choices.B: Deploy a new VMware Horizon pod on-premises.
choices.A: Deploy a new VMware Horizon pod on VMware Cloud on AWS.

discussion.content: For me A, D & F

Selected Answer: ADF
A, D, and F just make the best answer

Selected Answer: ADF
ADF makes sense

Selected Answer: ADF
new pod in cloud to scale quickly
I agree with A D F

questions.question_text: A new VMware Cloud on AWS customer has previously deployed a VMware Horizon-based VDI solution into their data centerto support their remote developer workforce. Due to unforeseen growth, the company needs to quickly expand their remote workforce. The growth will consume any forecast capacity in the VDI solution and, therefore, additional capacity is now required. The VDI solution service owner would like the solution to support the ability to quickly scale in/out to provide additional capacity based on demand. Which three steps should the administrator take to scale out the VDI solution? (Choose three.)
